entry.title: Creating my own LEGOs
entry.summary: Have you ever wonder if it is possible to refresh the feeling of playing with LEGOs once you are near your forties? Indeed, it is possible but after ten years of engineering the idea was not only to play with them, but to create my own. This is the story …
entry.content:
Have you ever wonder if it is possible to refresh the feeling of playing with LEGOs once you are near your forties? Indeed, it is possible but after ten years of engineering the idea was not only to play with them, but to create my own. This is the story of me creating my owns bricks while learning 3D printing and getting to know the MakerSpace56 at Vannes.

Let us start by setting up my intent:

  1. Let us create programatically my own bricks in such a way that they are stackable.

  2. My programmatic bricks shall be composable, which is the same to say that I expect to create a 2x1 piece using a 1x1 piece.

  3. I really love houses in the french Brittany, they are part of the cozy feeling of living in Bretagne. So, it would be nice to create a small set of parts capable of creating the smallest possible house.

Pieces

Piece Url to Code or STL
1x1 brick SOURCE
XxY brick SOURCE
Windows and doors SOURCE
Tiles SOURCE
Joist SOURCE

Creating a small house

Pictures

Lessons learned

  • It is really important to choose the right profile for printing. Using default UltiMake Cura 5.6 Standard profile, the tiles are problematic to connect to the joists. I had to destroy the pieces and glue them together. For the rest of the pieces, I uses the dynamic profile (which has a better quality) and the results were better.
  • Some of the pieces were printed with a LONGER LK 1 and Creality Ender Pro 3 v3 SE.

Software-Simulator

Brick v2

Brick v3

entry.title: Basic Plugin for Python Usage in VIM
entry.summary:
1. Install vim using your OS package manager.

Plugin Manager: Vundle

  1. Install Vundle.vim. We will clone the repository into ~/.vim/bundle/Vundle.vim

  2. edit the file .vimrc and set the following content:

set nocompatible              " be iMproved, required
filetype off                  " required

" set the runtime path to include Vundle and initialize
set …
entry.content:
1. Install vim using your OS package manager.

Plugin Manager: Vundle

  1. Install Vundle.vim. We will clone the repository into ~/.vim/bundle/Vundle.vim

  2. edit the file .vimrc and set the following content:

set nocompatible              " be iMproved, required
filetype off                  " required

" set the runtime path to include Vundle and initialize
set rtp+=~/.vim/bundle/Vundle.vim
call vundle#begin()

" let Vundle manage Vundle, required
Plugin 'VundleVim/Vundle.vim'

call vundle#end()            " required
filetype plugin indent on    " required
  1. Close vim and open it again. Type the command :PluginInstall. Check that nothing fails

Vim Jedi

  1. Open again the .vimrc file and add the new plugin:
" After Plugin 'VundleVim/Vundle.vim'
Plugin 'davidhalter/jedi-vim'

Save, close, open again and execute the vim command :PluginInstall

A few helpers if you feel lazy to open the doc

  • Control+Espace: list the help of a function
  • \ + d to jump to the definition of a function
  • :Pyimport Os: go to the definition of the module.

entry.title: ¿Cuántos Bernardini's llegaron via Barcos?
entry.summary:
Utilizando los datos del buscador de CEMLA (Centro de Estudios Migratorios Latinoamericanos)[0], se me ocurrió verificar cuantos Bernardini se bajaron de barcos en el puerto de Buenos Aires. Los datos son bastante interesantes. Aparentemente hubo un pico de llegada de Bernardini's en la decada del 20.

Lo que no …
entry.content:
Utilizando los datos del buscador de CEMLA (Centro de Estudios Migratorios Latinoamericanos)[0], se me ocurrió verificar cuantos Bernardini se bajaron de barcos en el puerto de Buenos Aires. Los datos son bastante interesantes. Aparentemente hubo un pico de llegada de Bernardini's en la decada del 20.

Lo que no se puede verificar con estos datos es si iban y volvían, y no hay informacion sobre gente que hubiese hecho escalas en Montevideo, o desembarcado en otros puertos (tales como el puerto de Santa Fe).

Fuentes: 1. https://cemla.com/buscador/
